intro: Campanula aurea, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are slightly hairy. Its flowers are clustered in racemes, and the plant prefers well-drained soil in full sun to partial shade. Campanula aurea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively easy to care for.
